name: Ivonne Hernandez
title: Front-End Software Developer
story: The goal of this application is to remove the language barrier that keeps a lot of Latinos from showing up to the polls. Itâ€™s meant to empower the Latino community by providing election resources and information in a language they know and understand so that they too, can have their voices be heard through their vote.

name: Alex McConnell
title: Back-End Software Developer
story: Voter empowerment has always been something important to me as larger companies have been continually taking over the entire political hemisphere. This project is another opportunity to do just that; empower voters who may not know how to use their voices.

name: Luis Arroyo
title: Back-End Software Developer
story: Being a Latino myself, I wanted to help create a tool that encourages and helps people in my family to get out and vote.

name: Elise Beall
title: Front-End Software Developer
story: As a former volunteer coordinator & field organizer of local & national political campaigns, I have seen first hand the divide created by language barriers & technical challenges.  Working on this application allowed me to focus on creating a tool to help level the playing field of electoral politics.
